Recipe can also be found on www.thespeedyspatula.com Recipe comes to 3 Freestyle Smart Points for 1 cup serving. Yields 8 cups. üî¥INGREDIENTSüî¥ 2 boneless skinless chicken breasts (mine were frozen), 10.5oz can fat free cream of mushroom soup, 1 cup nonfat plain Greek yogurt, 1 packet dry ranch dip mix, 1 cup water, 3 cups cooked white rice. üî¥DIRECTIONSüî¥ Spray a casserole @crockpot slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray (or any 4qt or larger slow cooker will work), add in the chicken breasts. In a small bowl, combine Greek yogurt, soup, water, and dry ranch seasoning. Stir until well combined and pour over the chicken. Cover and cook on high 5 hours or low 7 hours. Once cooked, remove chicken and shred between two forks, then stir back into the sauce. Cook rice according to package directions or in an Instant Pot or rice steamer. Once cooked, stir it into the chicken and sauce in the slow cooker. Serve hot and enjoy!

Description: I've been listening to this book recently (a self help book cause I'm lame like that üòú) and I really loved something she shared yesterday. She says let's say people go and see a movie, one women leaves crying saying it changed her life, moved by how profound it was and another leaves angry asking the ticket counter for her money back because it was the worst piece of garbage she's ever seen. Same movie, two different opinions. That hit me hard and is something I've been thinking a lot about lately.

All I can do is be 100%, unapologetically me, and people are not gonna like it. It's inevitable. And you better believe they're gonna tell me about it (behind their little smartphones of course). But that's OKAY, and letting go of caring is what will set all of us free. It's a burden that is so unnecessary to hold. It's better to be you and have people dislike you, than to be someone you're not and have people love you.

Now, I'm a people pleaser at heart so you better believe this is VERY difficult for me. It's something that I've realized I never can stop practicing (letting go of caring). And I have to continually get better and better and it. So, as @actuallyitsaxel said yesterday, rule #1, f*ck what they think üíô.
_____
As a side note, don't be surprised if I delete your rude comments. You're allowed to have them. Yes. But I don't need that negativity on my page, and I have the power to delete them. Xo

However that is not the end all predetermined destiny of a mother's body. Our bodies are amazing and specifically designed to grow and birth a child and then recover. It doesn't happen over night and you have to make conscientious decisions to eat healthy and exercise but it's possible! Post-babies my workout routine transitioned from gym workouts to home workouts and as a mother I naturally found myself eating healthier (only eating what I would want my kids to eat) plus frequent happy hours and Sunday fundays üçæbecame a thing of the past. I've actually started each pregnancy smaller and more fit than one before. üí™üèº So ladies have no fear, enjoy your healthy pregnancy and give your body appropriate time postpartum to recover. Continue to eat healthy, dedicate 30 mins a day to being active and you will be surprised when you look better post-baby than pre-baby! #transformation #fitmom #strongmom #veganmom

Muchas veces nos cuestionan si realmente es un trabajo, pero hay much√≠simo que no se ve: reuniones, planificaciones, reportes, estadisticas, contenido visual y escrito, reuniones etc.

Gracias a todos los que nos siguen, creen en lo que hacemos y tambi√©n a los que creen, apoyan y especialmente valoran el trabajo que hacemos, no solo nosotras sino muchos otros bloggers en Guatemala.

Estamos agradecidas con cada oportunidad que se nos presenta y comprometidas con transmitirnos tal y cual somos.
